children.heading: ISO 26048-1 Needs Included
children.text: All the architectural needs are defined within the user needs of ISO 26048-1. Commonly used architectural needs within the scope of a ESS are listed in the PRL with references to the relevant ISO 26048-1 clauses and include the following:

children.heading: Authenticate users
children.text: allows users to ensure that all communications with the device are with authenticated users.

attributesChanged.text: Authenticate users: allows users to ensure that all communications with the device are with authenticated users.

children.heading: Control Access to Data
children.text: allows administrators to configure the detailed accessprivilegesthat are granted to each authenticated user.

discussion.comment: How do we want to handle placeholders for ISO 26048-1 user needs?

children.heading: Monitor failed access to the field device
children.text: allows administrators to discover when unauthorized attempts are made to access the device.

children.heading: Manage the field device
children.text: allows a user to remotely reset the controller and configure and monitor basic information about the field device, such as its:
Identity,
Location,
Power source,
Default language,
Capabilities (e.g., which objects are supported, maximum message size),
Status, and
Configuration identifier.

children.heading: Monitor ambient environment
children.text: allows a user to monitor the ambient environment, including:

children.heading: Monitor field device enclosure
children.text: allows a user to monitor the device environment and enclosure(s), including:

attributesChanged.text: allows a user to monitor the device enclosure(s), including:

children.heading: Monitor field device enclosure air temperature
Manage enclosure climate control components
children.text: allows a user to monitor and control climate control components, including:

attributesChanged.text: allows a user to monitor and control support equipment, including:

children.heading: Monitor field device power
children.text: allows a user to monitor and control power equipment, including:

children.heading: Manage auxiliary ports
children.text: allows a user to monitor and control support equipment, including:

children.heading: Manage field device auxiliary bi-directional ports

attributesChanged.text: allows a user to define trigger conditions (e.g., an object value exceeding a defined value) and to automatically receive an SNMP notification when the trigger condition occurs.

children.heading: Receive notification of triggers firing
children.text: allows a user to define trigger conditions (e.g., an object value exceeding a defined value) and to automatically receive an SNMP notification when the trigger condition occurs.

children.heading: Manage device-specific notifications
children.text: allows the user to configure all supported notifications to use notification channels, which prevent notifications from flooding the communications channel.

children.heading: Log system events
children.text: allows the device to record information about internal events that can be of interest during forensic analysis, e.g., for debugging purposes.

children.heading: Log user-defined data snapshots
children.text: allows a user to define trigger conditions (e.g., an object value exceeding a defined value) and to automatically log information when the trigger condition occurs.

children.heading: Issue trigger-based commands
children.text: allows a user to define trigger conditions (e.g., an object value exceeding a defined value) and to automatically send another device an SNMP set request when the trigger condition occurs. For example, when ice is detected by a pavement sensor, command an attached gate to close (however, this example is discouraged as a gate closure should include verification mechanisms not offered by this feature to ensure safe operations).

children.heading: ISO 26048-1 Needs Omitted due to Duplication
Monitor ambient air temperature
children.text: The body of this document provides a more robust way to monitor ambient air temperature (2.5.2.1.3) that predates the design contained in ISO 26048-1.

children.heading: Monitor ambient relative humidity
children.text: The body of this document provides a more robust way to monitor ambient relative humidity (2.5.2.1.4) that predates the design contained in ISO 26048-1.

children.heading: ISO 26048-1 Needs not Envisioned for ESS
Monitor ambient light
children.text: allows the device to measure ambient light levels (e.g., from the sun).

children.heading: Record a series of data snapshots
children.text: allows a user to define trigger conditions (e.g., an object value exceeding a defined value) and to automatically log a series of snapshots based on the trigger condition occurring. For example, when the cabinet door opens, record the cabinet temperature once a second for 60 seconds.

children.heading: Configure a complex device
children.text: allows a user to buffer changes to a large number of inter-related configuration parameters so that the proposed changes can be validated as a whole prior to ensure a safe configuration prior to implementation.

children.heading: Efficient exchange of data
children.text: allows a management station to define dynamic objects that can be used for frequent requests to reduce communications overhead. For example, rather than monitoring 15 discreet status objects, the 15 objects can be placed into a dynamic object and retrieved as a single entity. This can be useful when a management station frequently exchanges a large number of integer values with the device.

children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the movements of a mobile ESS. This feature allows the transportation system operator to determine the location where sensor readings are collected.

children.heading: Sensor Manager Features
children.text: Section 2.5.2 identifies and describes the various features that may be offered by the Sensor Manager:
monitor weather conditions

children.text: monitor pavement

attributesChanged.text: b)     monitor pavement

children.text: monitor subsurface conditions

attributesChanged.text: c)     monitor subsurface conditions

attributesChanged.text: d)     monitor human readings

children.heading: Monitor Ambient Weather Conditions
children.text: This feature focuses on ambient weather conditions that can directly or indirectly affect the transportation system. It includes the following sub-features.

children.heading: Monitor Atmospheric Pressure
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the atmospheric pressure in the vicinity of the ESS and to configure and retrieve the metadata for the atmospheric pressure measurements. This feature allows the operator to monitor changing weather conditions.

children.heading: Monitor Winds
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the current wind conditions in the vicinity of the ESS and to configure and retrieve the metadata for the wind measurements. This feature allows an operator to determine if vehicle restrictions on a given roadway or bridge span should be issued or to restrict roadway maintenance (e.g., fire alerts).

children.heading: Monitor Air Temperature
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the air temperature at the ESS location and to configure and retrieve the metadata for the temperature measurement. This feature allows an operator to dispatch maintenance vehicles to treat roadway pavement or to determine if restrictions or warnings to travelers should be issued.

children.heading: Monitor Relative Humidity
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the relative humidity at the ESS location and to configure and retrieve the metadata for the humidity measurement. This feature allows an operator to schedule roadway maintenance activities, such as painting.

children.heading: Monitor Precipitation
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the amount, intensity, and type of precipitation in the vicinity of the ESS and to configure and retrieve the metadata for the precipitation measurements. This feature allows an operator to determine if restrictions or warnings, such as flood warnings, should be issued to travelers.

children.heading: Monitor Solar Radiation
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the amount of solar radiation in the vicinity of the ESS and to configure and retrieve the metadata for the solar radiation measurements. This feature allows an operator to schedule maintenance activities (e.g., based on pavement temperatures) or restrict roadway usage.

children.heading: Monitor Visibility
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the visibility in the vicinity of the ESS and to configure and retrieve the metadata for the visibility measurement. This feature allows an operator to determine if restrictions or warnings are needed, such as lowering vehicle speed limits.

children.heading: View Environmental Image
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to visually inspect weather or pavement conditions and/or verify the reported weather or pavement conditions.

children.heading: Monitor Dewpoint Temperature
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the dew point temperature. The dew point temperature can be calculated or measured, and is used to determine the temperature when condensation (dew, frost) occurs.

children.heading: Monitor Pavement
children.text: This feature focuses on monitoring road conditions that may adversely affect transportation operations immediately or in the near future. It supports the transportation system operator's ability to dispatch equipment to address the condition or to provide appropriate warnings. It includes the following sub-features.

children.heading: Monitor Pavement Surface Condition
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the pavement surface temperature, the moisture condition (e.g., dry, wet, snowy, icy, chemical concentration, etc.) on and around the roadway pavement, and to configure and retrieve the metadata for the roadway pavement sensors. This feature allows an operator to monitor for readings that could lead to hazardous conditions on the roadway based on moisture or low roadway friction, and allows maintenance managers to determine, in combination with other data, if they need to treat the road.

children.heading: Monitor Icing Conditions
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor whether pavement conditions are likely for ice formation on the pavement. This includes the ability to monitor pavement temperature (i.e., as opposed to surface temperature), the depth of any water film on the surface, and the predicted freeze point of the surface. This feature focuses on the conditions on the roadway pavement surface that can directly or indirectly lead to icing that affects the transportation system. A transportation system operator may also need to monitor and configure the RPU parameters. The operator needs to be able to change the parameters based on the treatment that is being applied on the pavement so accurate readings are measured by the pavement sensors.

children.heading: View Pavement Image
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to visually inspect pavement conditions and/or verify the reported pavement conditions.

children.heading: Monitor Subsurface Conditions
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to retrieve the conditions below the road surface and to retrieve the metadata for the subsurface measurements. The operator may monitor for readings that could lead to road damage and/or affect the onset of icing conditions (e.g., water level table). It supports the transportation system operator's ability to dispatch equipment to address the condition or to provide appropriate warnings.

children.heading: Monitor Human Readings
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to retrieve data that was manually observed and entered by field personnel, such as a snow plow operator. This feature allows an operator to verify measured sensor readings.

children.heading: Monitor Water Level
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the depth of water at one or more locations (e.g., over a roadway, in a stream, of a reservoir, etc.). This feature allows an operator to issue flood warnings to travelers, public safety agencies, and maintenance crews, if necessary.

children.heading: Monitor Air Quality and Biohazards
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor the current air quality in the vicinity of the ESS and to retrieve the metadata for the air quality measurements. The operator may monitor these measurements to determine whether there are airborne biohazards in the vicinity of the ESS. These measurements are also used to issue ozone alert warnings to the public.

children.heading: Monitor Mobile Weather Profile
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to monitor information that is specific to a mobile ESS such as its position and data collected. This feature allows an operator to log the route of the mobile ESS and develop an environmental profile that can be used as an input for weather forecast models or maintenance decision support systems. This may also include odometer readings for verification purposes.

children.heading: Pavement Treatment System Manager Features
children.text: The following identify and describe the various features that may be offered by a Pavement Treatment System Manager. It consists of the following features:
manage stationary spray system

attributesChanged.text: a)     manage stationary spray system

children.text: manage mobile spray system

attributesChanged.text: b)     manage mobile spray system

children.heading: Manage Stationary Spray System
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to manage the application of anti-icing or de-icing chemicals through the use of a sprayer connected to a permanent or transportable ESS (e.g., a bridge sprayer). This feature includes the configuration, monitoring, and activation of a permanent or transportable spray system. This feature allows pre-treatment of the roadway pavement, either manually or programmatically, before hazardous conditions occur, or to remedy a hazardous condition.

children.heading: Manage Mobile Spray System
children.text: A transportation system operator may need to manage the application of anti-icing or de-icing materials from a mobile pavement treatment system (e.g., a salt truck). This feature allows an operator to monitor and change the rate anti-icing or de-icing materials are applied.

children.heading: Backward Compatibility Needs
children.text: SNMPv3 is not backwards compatible with SNMPv1 without the use of a proxy agent. Implementations that need to exchange data with implementations conforming to NTCIP 1204 versions prior to v05 should reference the requirements and design elements of the specific version of NTCIP 1204 to be used.

children.heading: Security
children.text: A management station needs to have confidence that communications with its devices are always secure and trustworthy. This requires confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

children.heading: Addressing Vulnerabilities
children.text: This document standardizes the objects that can be used by a remote entity to monitor and/or control a device. Allowing remote operations without providing sufficient information security can have a negative effect on the communications network and/or the transportation system. In particular, the mis-configuration of "read-write" and/or "read-create" objects can result in the activation of unauthorized features or unauthorized changes to the device configuration; these changes can result in potentially hazardous situations.

Further, even failing to secure exchanges of "read-only" objects can have harmful effects. Providing unauthorized access to read-only objects can reveal information about the device that can be useful in conducting a cyber-attack against the device itself, other devices, and potentially the central system. Likewise, failing to authenticate the source of the read-only data allows a cyber threat actor to potentially impersonate the device and provide false information to a traffic management center.

The object types defined by this document are intended to be transmitted over SNMPv3. SNMP versions prior to SNMPv3 do not include adequate security. Prior SNMP versions do not provide any control as to who on the network is allowed to access and read/change/create/delete objects, even if the network itself is secure.

children.heading: Conformant Security Environment
children.text: The conformant security environment is highly recommended as it does not allow the device to support any unsecured protocol.

children.heading: Consistent Security Environment
children.text: It is recognized that during a transition to a secure environment, agencies might need to procure equipment that conforms to their current unsecured environment while still wanting something that can be reconfigured to support their future secure environment. This is allowed as long as the device is able to disable the unsecured protocols. Nonetheless, the fact that consistent devices support unsecured protocols mean that the unsecured protocols can be enabled and the device is inherently less secure than a conformant device.

children.heading: Scope of the Interface [Informative]
children.text: Section 3.2 does not apply in the context of this document.

children.heading: Manage Atmospheric Pressure Sensors
children.text: Requirements for managing atmospheric pressure sensors follow.

children.heading: Determine Number of Atmospheric Pressure Sensors
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the number of atmospheric pressure sensors connected to the ESS.

children.heading: Retrieve Atmospheric Pressure Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information for the specified atmospheric pressure sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location;
the relative height of the sensor from the reference height of the ESS; and
the location of the sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Atmospheric Pressure Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the entity identifier of the specified atmospheric pressure sensor so that the management station is able to properly interpret the accuracy, resolution and limits of the data.

children.heading: Configure Atmospheric Pressure Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the following information for a specified atmospheric pressure sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location;
relative height of the sensor from the reference height of the ESS; and
the location of the sensor.

children.heading: Configure Atmospheric Pressure Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the index of the entry in the physical entity table (entPhysicalTable) that is associated with the specified atmospheric pressure sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Wind Data
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information reported by the specified wind sensor:

discussion.comment: windSensorSituation says it is staffed, but in this context it is automatically derived...

children.text: the average wind speed recorded during the 2 minutes preceding the observation;
the average direction the wind is blowing from, as recorded during the 2 minutes preceding the observation;
the current wind speed;
the current direction the wind is blowing from;
the maximum wind gust recorded during the 10 minutes preceding the observation;
the direction of the maximum wind gust recorded during the 10 minutes preceding the observation; and

the assessment of the wind situation from a staffed station as defined by the Beaufort Wind Scale in the Glossary of Meteorology. Valid values are: other, unknown, calm, light breeze, moderate breeze, strong breeze, gale, moderate gale, strong gale, storm winds, hurricane force winds, and gusty winds.

children.heading: Configure Precipitation Total User-Specified Period
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the user-specified collection period for measuring the precipitation recorded for a specified precipitation sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Precipitation Presence
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return an indication of whether precipitation is currently being reported by the specified precipitation sensor. Precipitation is detected if 0.01 inches of liquid water equivalent is detected.

children.heading: Retrieve Precipitation Rates
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the the following information reported by the specified precipitation sensor:
the current water-equivalent rate of precipitation;
the rate that snow is accumulating; and
the start and stop times of the latest recorded precipitation event. The precipitation event can be rainfall or snowfall.

children.heading: Retrieve Precipitation Totals
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the total amount of precipitation recorded over the last one hour, three hour, six hour, twelve hour, and twenty-four hour rolling periods, reported by the specified precipitation sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Precipitation Totals - User Specified
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the total amount of precipitation recorded over a user specified, rolling time period for the specified precipitation sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Precipitation Type
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the assessment of the type and intensity of the current precipitation situation. The precipitation intensity shall be defined as follows: slight < 2 mm/hour water equivalent, moderate is 2 and < 8 mm/hour equivalent, and heavy is 8 mm/hour water equivalent.

the location of the sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Solar Radiation Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the entity identifier of the specified solar radiation sensor so that the management station is able to properly interpret the accuracy, resolution and limits of the data.

children.heading: Configure Solar Radiation Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the following information for a specified solar radiation sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location;
the relative height of the sensor to the reference height of the ESS; and
the location of the sensor.

children.heading: Configure Solar Radiation Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the index of the entry in the physical entity table (entPhysicalTable) that is associated with the specified solar radiation sensor.

discussion.comment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a sensor)

history.addedComment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a sensor)

children.heading: Retrieve Solar Radiation
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the solar radiation data reported by each solar radiation sensor. The types of measured solar radiation data that the ESS shall provide are:
the total minutes of sunshine measured over the preceding 24-hour period, as defined by WMO Code Form FM 94 BUFR Table B item 0 14 031;
the instantaneous infrared radiation measured, in watts per square meter, as defined by WMO Code Form FM 94 BUFR Table B item 0 14 017;
the instantaneous ultraviolet, visible and near-infrared radiation measured, in watts per square meter, as defined by WMO Code Form FM 94 BUFR Table B item 0 14 018; and
the average total radiation measured, in watts per square meter, as defined by WMO Code Form FM 94 BUFR Table B item 0 14 025, over a user defined rolling period, measured in seconds.

children.heading: Manage Visibility Sensor
children.text: Requirements for managing visibility sensors follow.

children.heading: Determine Number of Visibility Sensors
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the number of visibility sensors connected to the ESS.

children.heading: Retrieve Visibility Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information for a visibility sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location;
the direction that the sensor uses to measure distance
the relative height of the sensor to the reference height of the ESS; and
the location of the sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Visibility Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the entity identifier of the visibility sensor so that the management station is able to properly interpret the accuracy, resolution and limits of the data.

children.heading: Configure Visibility Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the following information for a visibility sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location;
the relative height of the sensor to the reference height of the ESS; and
the location of the sensor.

children.heading: Configure Visibility Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the index of the entry in the physical entity table (entPhysicalTable) that is associated with the visibility sensor.

discussion.comment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a sensor)

history.addedComment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a sensor)

children.heading: Retrieve Visibility
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current visibility distance.

discussion.comment: Object was previously deprecated but RTM still traces to it and there is no replacement

children.heading: Manage Pavement Sensors
children.text: Requirements for managing pavement sensors follow.

children.heading: Determine Number of Pavement Sensors
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the number of pavement sensors connected to the ESS.

children.heading: Retrieve Pavement Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information for the specified pavement sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location and the location of the area the sensor is monitoring;
the relative height of the pavement surface to the reference height of the ESS;
the location of the sensor; and
the location of the geometric center of the surface area that the sensor is monitoring.

children.heading: Retrieve Pavement Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the entity identifier of the specified pavement sensor so that the management station is able to properly interpret the accuracy, resolution and limits of the data.

children.heading: Configure Pavement Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the following information for the specified pavement sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location and the location of the area the sensor is monitoring;
the relative height of the pavement surface to the reference height of the ESS.
the location of the sensor; and
the location of the geometric center of the pavement surface area that the sensor is monitoring.

children.heading: Configure Pavement Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the index of the entry in the physical entity table (entPhysicalTable) that is associated with the specified pavement sensor.

discussion.comment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a sensor)

history.addedComment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a sensor)

children.heading: Retrieve Pavement Sensor Metadata
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information for the specified pavement sensor:
a textual description of the location that the pavement sensor is monitoring;
the type of pavement the sensor is monitoring;
an indication of the skyview factor to which the monitored pavement is subjected. A value of 100 (percent) indicates a fully visible sky; and
an indication of the sensor technology used.

children.heading: Configure Pavement Sensor Metadata
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store configuration information for a specified pavement sensor. The configuration information includes:
a textual description of the location that the pavement sensor is monitoring;
the type of pavement the sensor is monitoring; and
an indication of the skyview factor to which the monitored pavement is subjected.

children.heading: Configure Passive Ice Detection Logic
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store information regarding the pavement treatments being applied so that the ESS may more accurately estimate icing conditions using passive logic. The information includes:
the number of different pavement treatments types;
the type of each pavement treatment;
the form of each pavement treatment type; and
the percentage of each pavement treatment type and form by total application weight.
Different pavement treatments may be the same pavement treatment type but in different forms and in different percentages (by weight).
Note: There are now combinations of pavement treatments that are used, and they may impact the calibration of the algorithms used.

children.heading: Retrieve Conditions for Freezing Algorithms - Active
children.text: There are two methods to determine ice and moisture conditions on the pavement surface active and passive. Active pavement sensors determine the freeze point on the pavement surface by actively freezing a portion of the roadway surface. For an active pavement sensor, upon request, the ESS shall return:
the pavement surface temperature;
the pavement temperature;
the depth below the pavement surface that the pavement temperature is measured;
the freeze point on the pavement surface at which the existing solution on the roadway freezes;
whether black ice is currently detected on the pavement surface;
the depth of any water/solution film or ice on the pavement surface; and
an indication of whether any of this data might be in error.

children.heading: Retrieve Conditions for Freezing Algorithms - Passive
children.text: There are two methods to determine ice and moisture conditions on the pavement surface - active and passive. Passive pavement sensors determine the freeze point on the pavement surface using algorithms without freezing the chemical mixture on the roadway surface. For a passive pavement sensor, upon request, the ESS shall return the following:
the pavement surface temperature;
the pavement temperature;
the depth below the pavement surface that the pavement temperature is measured;
the freeze point on the pavement surface at which the existing solution on the roadway freezes;
whether black ice is currently detected on the pavement surface;
the depth of any water/solution film or ice on the pavement surface;
the salinity of the water/solution film on the pavement surface;
the conductivity of the water/solution film on the pavement surface, as detected by the pavement surface sensor;
an indication of whether any of this data might be in error;
the pavement treatment type used for algorithm;
the form of each pavement treatment type; and
the percentage of the total application weight that is of the pavement treatment type.

children.heading: Retrieve Pavement Surface Temperature
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information reported by the specified pavement sensor:
the current pavement surface temperature; and
the validity of the data reported.

children.heading: Retrieve Pavement Surface Condition
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information reported by the specified pavement sensor:
any presence of moisture and the type of moisture on the surface; and
the validity of the data reported.

children.heading: Retrieve Forecasted Pavement Surface Condition
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the forecasted pavement surface condition for the specified pavement sensor. The forecast is derived based on the current pavement surface condition and other weather observations.

children.heading: Retrieve Roadway Friction Coefficient
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the estimated friction coefficient of the roadway pavement for the specified pavement sensor. The actual coefficient of friction is dependent on many variables, including characteristics of the tire traveling on the pavement; thus it is recognized that it is impossible to provide a on a single mathematically precise value. However, the reported friction coefficient shall be based on an empirical model that has a strong correlation with actual measured friction coefficients using a standard test method and test apparatus, such as a decelerometer or a surface friction tester.

discussion.comment: See exact wording of requirement

children.heading: Retrieve Adjacent Snow Depth
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current depth of snow adjacent to the traveled way (e.g., shoulders) for the specified sensor. The depth shall be representative of the snow depth in the area, exclusive of plowed areas and snow drifts.

discussion.comment: In v04, this was traced to a scalar get, but if these are the right objects, it needs to be a tabular get.

children.heading: Retrieve Roadway Snow Depth
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current depth of packed and unpacked snow on the roadway pavement (i.e., roadway, rail line, etc.) for the specified sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Roadway Ice Thickness
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current thickness of ice on the roadway pavement reported by the specified pavement sensor.

children.heading: Manage Subsurface Sensors
children.text: Requirements for managing subsurface sensors follow.

children.heading: Determine Number of Subsurface Sensors
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the number of subsurface sensors connected to the ESS.

children.heading: Retrieve Subsurface Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information for the specified subsurface sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location; and
the location of the geometric center of the sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Subsurface Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the entity identifier of the specified subsurface sensor so that the management station is able to properly interpret the accuracy, resolution and limits of the data.

children.heading: Configure Subsurface Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the following information for a specified subsurface sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location; and
the location of the geometric center of the sensor.

children.heading: Configure Subsurface Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the index of the entry in the physical entity table (entPhysicalTable) that is associated with the specified subsurface sensor.

discussion.comment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a sensor)

history.addedComment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a sensor)

children.heading: Retrieve Subsurface Sensor Metadata
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information for the specified subsurface sensor:
a textual description of the location that the sensor is monitoring;
the type of subsurface the sensor is monitoring; and
the depth of the sensor location below the pavement surface.

children.heading: Configure Subsurface Sensor Metadata
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store configuration information for a specified subsurface sensor. The configuration information includes:
a textual description of the location that the sensor is monitoring;
the type of subsurface the sensor is monitoring; and
the depth of the sensor location below the pavement surface.

children.heading: Retrieve Subsurface Temperature
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current subsurface temperature reported by the specified subsurface sensor. The ESS shall also return an indication of whether this data might be in error.

children.heading: Retrieve Subsurface Moisture
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the amount of moisture currently reported by the specified subsurface sensor. A value of 0% indicates that the subsurface is dry, while a value of 100% indicates the subsurface is saturated.

children.heading: Manage Air Quality Sensors
children.text: Requirements for managing air quality sensors follow.

children.heading: Determine Number of Air Quality Sensors
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the number of air quality sensors connected to the ESS.

children.heading: Retrieve Air Quality Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information for the specified air quality sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location;
the relative height of the sensor to the reference height of the ESS; and
the location of the sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Air Quality Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the entity identifier of the specified air quality sensor so that the management station is able to properly interpret the accuracy, resolution and limits of the data.

children.heading: Configure Air Quality Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the following information for a specified air quality sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location;
the relative height of the sensor to the reference height of the ESS; and
the location of the sensor.

children.heading: Configure Air Quality Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the index of the entry in the physical entity table (entPhysicalTable) that is associated with the specified air quality sensor.

discussion.comment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a sensor)

children.heading: Retrieve Carbon Monoxide Reading
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current concentration detected by the specified air quality sensor of carbon monoxide.

children.heading: Retrieve Nitrogen Dioxide Reading
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current concentration detected by the specified air quality sensor of nitrogen dioxide.

children.heading: Retrieve Sulfur Dioxide Reading
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current concentration detected by the specified air quality sensor of sulfur dioxide.

children.heading: Retrieve Small Particulate Matter Reading
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current concentration detected by the specified air quality sensor of small particulate matter of 10 micrometers or less in diameter.

children.heading: Retrieve Particulate Matter 2.5 Reading
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current concentration detected by the specified air quality sensor of small particulate matter of 2.5 micrometers or less in diameter.

children.heading: Retrieve Particulate Matter 1.0 Reading
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current concentration detected by the specified air quality sensor of small particulate matter of 1.0 micrometers or less in diameter.

children.heading: Retrieve Carbon Dioxide Reading
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current concentration detected by the specified air quality sensor of carbon dioxide.

children.heading: Retrieve Nitric Oxide Reading
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current concentration detected by the specified air quality sensor of nitric oxide.

children.heading: Retrieve Ozone Reading
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current concentration detected by the specified air quality sensor of ozone.

children.heading: Manage Water Level Sensors
children.text: Requirements for managing water level sensors follow.

children.heading: Determine Number of Water Level Sensors
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the number of water level sensors connected to the ESS.

children.heading: Retrieve Water Level Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information for the specified water level sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location, including a description of the reference point that the water depth is measured against;
the relative height of the sensor to the reference height of the ESS; and
the location of the sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Water Level Sensor Identity
children.text: Upn request, the ESS shall return the entity identifier of the specified water level sensor so that the management station is able to properly interpret the accuracy, resolution, and limits of the data.

children.heading: Retrieve Water Level Sensor Warning Level
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the water level depth that is a cause of concern for the specified water level sensor. This water level depth may be the depth when the water levels may overflow onto the roadway pavement, or may damage electronic roadside equipment in a cabinet.

children.heading: Configure Water Level Sensor Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the following information for a specified water level sensor:
a textual description of the sensor location, including a description of the reference point that the water depth is measured against;
the relative height of the sensor to the reference height of the ESS; and
the location of the sensor.

children.heading: Configure Water Level Sensor Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the index of the entry in the physical entity table (entPhysicalTable) that is associated with the specified water level sensor.

history.addedComment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a sensor)

children.heading: Configure Water Level Sensor Warning Level
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the water level depth that is a cause of concern for the specified water level sensor.

children.heading: Retrieve Water Level
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current depth of water from a user defined point for the specified water level sensor. The current depth of water can be over a body of water, such as a stream or a reservoir, or the current depth of water on a roadway pavement, such as an underpass. This requirement is concerned with the water depth in bodies of water or the pavement surface for flooding concerns, as opposed to requirements 3.5.2.8.9 or 3.5.2.8.10, water film depth, which are concerned about icing or hydroplaning on the pavement surface.

attributesChanged.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the current depth of water from a user defined point for the specified water level sensor. The current depth of water can be over a body of water, such as a stream or a reservoir, or the current depth of water on a roadway pavement, such as an underpass. This requirement is concerned with the water depth in bodies of water or the pavement surface for flooding concerns, as opposed to requirements 0.f or 0.f, water film depth, which are concerned about icing or hydroplaning on the pavement surface.

children.heading: Monitor Situation Assessments
children.text: Requirements for monitoring situation assessments follow.

children.heading: Retrieve Wind Situation
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the assessment of the wind situation from a staffed station as defined by the Beaufort Wind Scale in the Glossary of Meteorology.

children.heading: Retrieve Precipitation Situation
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the assessment of the type and intensity of the current precipitation situation. The assessment may be made through automated processes, or if it is a staffed station, manually.

children.heading: Retrieve Visibility Situation
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the assessment of the visibility situation. The assessment may be made through automated processes, or if it is a staffed station, manually.

children.heading: Retrieve Cloud Situation
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the amount of cloud cover in the sky, measured in oktas, as defined in WMO code table 2700. The assessment may be made through automated processes, or if it is a staffed station, manually.

children.heading: Retrieve Ground State
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the assessment of the ground state next to the roadway (the roadside, and not the roadway pavement or shoulders). The assessment is made from a staffed station.

children.heading: Retrieve Pavement State
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the assessment of the pavement surface. The assessment is made from a staffed station.

children.heading: Manage Snapshot Cameras
children.text: Requirements for managing snapshot cameras follow.

children.heading: Determine Supported Image Storage Formats
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the image storage formats that are supported by the specified snapshot camera.

children.heading: Configure Snapshot Camera
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store a textual description of the location and direction to which the specified camera points along with the filename and file format to be used when storing new snapshots from the specified camera.

children.heading: Retrieve Snapshot Camera Configuration
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information for the specified snapshot camera:
the textual description of the location to which the camera points;
the file path where new snapshots are stored;
the filename to be used when storing new snapshots; and
the file format to be used when storing new snapshots.

children.heading: Capture Snapshot Image
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall capture the current image (snapshot) from the specified attached camera and store it per the configured storage path, filename, and format. The ESS shall report any errors in performing this task.

children.heading: Retrieve Snapshot
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return a copy of the specified snapshot image.

children.heading: Delete Snapshot
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall delete the specified snapshot image.

children.heading: Retrieve Sensor Profile with Mobile Sources
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return a list of records recorded by the ESS over a period of time, with each record containing the below information about the mobile station. Each piece of information shall be present if the data is supported by the implementation and is valid. If the piece of information is invalid or not supported by the implementation, that piece of information shall be omitted.

the location of the mobile platform consisting of the latitude, longitude, and height. The latitude and longitude are in microdegrees (10-6 degrees). The height of the mobile platform (ESS) is in meters above mean sea level, and is measured to the surface under the vehicle;
the speed of the mobile platform in kilometers per hour;
the bearing (direction of travel) of the mobile platform in degrees, measured clockwise from True North;
the distance traveled, in meters, by the mobile platform from a reference point;
wind data;

children.heading: PTS Manager Requirements
children.text: Requirements for managing a PTS manager follow.

children.heading: PTS Configuration Requirements
children.text: Requirements for configuring a PTS manager follow.

children.heading: Retrieve Pavement Treatment System Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the following information for the pavement treatment system:
a textual description of the pavement treatment system location; and
the location of the pavement treatment system.

children.heading: Retrieve Pavement Treatment System Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall return the entity identifier of the pavement treatment system so that the management station is able to properly interpret the capabilities of the pavement treatment system.

children.heading: Configure Pavement Treatment System Location
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the following information for a pavement treatment system:
a textual description of the pavement treatment system location; and
the location of the pavement treatment system.

children.heading: Configure Pavement Treatment System Identity
children.text: Upon request, the ESS shall store the index of the entry in the physical entity table (entPhysicalTable) that is associated with the pavement treatment system.

discussion.comment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a component)

history.addedComment: For deletion (i.e., on 7/25 we decided to make the EntityID objects read-only and that they should be configured using proprietary process when installing a component)

children.heading: Retrieve Stationary Pavement Treatment Configuration
children.text: Upon request, the PTS shall return the configuration data for a stationary pavement treatment system identifying:
the pavement sensors that the PTS monitors to determine when to trigger the sprayers;
the duration required for a signal to activate the sprayer;
the number of pavement treatment products that the PTS has been programmed for; and
for each pavement treatment product, the pavement treatment product type, pavement treatment form and the percentage mix (by weight).

A pavement treatment product is a chemical that can be applied to the roadway to de-ice or prevent icing of the pavement. This requirement allows a transportation system operator to determine what pavement treatments may be applied by the PTS.

children.heading: Configure Stationary Pavement Treatment System
children.text: Upon request, the PTS shall change the configuration for a stationary pavement treatment system identifying:
the pavement sensors that the PTS monitors to determine when to trigger the sprayers;
the duration required for a signal to activate the sprayer;
the number of pavement treatment products that the PTS has been programmed for; and
for each pavement treatment product, the pavement treatment type, pavement treatment form and the percentage mix (by weight).

children.heading: Configure Mobile Pavement Treatment System
children.text: Upon request, the PTS shall change the configuration for a mobile pavement treatment system identifying:
the quantity of treatment being applied;
the width of the spread of treatment;
the minimum amount of time the sprayer needs to detect a signal to activate and the duration to stay active; and
for each pavement treatment product that the PTS has been programmed for, the pavement treatment type, pavement treatment form and the percentage mix (by weight).

children.heading: Retrieve Mobile Pavement Treatment Configuration
children.text: Upon request, the PTS shall return the configuration data for a mobile pavement treatment system identifying:
the quantity of pavement treatment being applied;
the width of the spread of treatment; and
for each pavement treatment product that the PTS has been programmed for, the pavement treatment type, pavement treatment form and the percentage mix (by weight).

A pavement treatment product is a chemical that can be applied to the roadway to de-ice or prevent icing of the pavement. This requirement allows a transportation system operator to determine what pavement treatments may be applied by the PTS.

children.heading: PTS Status Monitoring Requirements
children.text: Requirements for monitoring the status of a PTS manager follow.

attributesChanged.text: Requirements for monitoring a PTS manager follow.

children.heading: Retrieve Pavement Treatment Status
children.text: Upon request, the PTS shall return the current status of the sprayer and the number of spray events that have occurred on a pavement treatment system. The status consists of:
whether the sprayer is currently active (spraying);
a counter indicating the number of signal events that have occurred;
the date and time the sprayer last received a signal event;
a counter indicating the number of active events that have occurred;
a counter indicating the number of inactive events that have occurred;
the date and time the sprayer of the last active event;
the date and time the sprayer of the last inactive event; and
the state of readiness of the sprayer.

children.heading: PTS Data Retrieval Requirements
children.text: Requirements for retrieving data from a PTS manager follow.

attributesChanged.text: Requirements for retrieving a PTS manager follow.

children.heading: Retrieve Pavement Treatment Profile with Mobile Sources
children.text: Upon request, a mobile PTS shall return a list of records recorded by the PTS over a period of time, with each record containing the below information about the mobile PTS. Each piece of information shall be present if the data is supported by the implementation and is valid. If the piece of information is invalid or not supported by the implementation, that piece of information shall be omitted.
the location of the mobile platform consisting of the latitude, longitude, and height;
the speed of the mobile platform;
the bearing (direction of travel) of the mobile platform;
the distance traveled by the mobile platform from a reference point;
the quantity of treatment being applied;
the width of the spread of treatment; and
for each pavement treatment product that the PTS has been programmed for, the pavement treatment type, pavement treatment form and the percentage mix (by weight).

children.heading: PTS Control Requirements
children.text: Requirements for controlling a PTS manager follow.

children.heading: Set PTS Operational Mode
children.text: Upon request, the stationary PTS shall change its operational mode to that requested. Valid operational modes are:
Off, which shall prevent any operation of the sprayer;
Manual, which shall allow manual activation of the sprayer; and
Automatic, which shall allow either manual activation or activation based on internal logic per the configuration parameters.

children.heading: Manually Activate PTS Sprayer
children.text: Upon request, the stationary PTS shall trigger the sprayer to spray its pavement treatment solution. The trigger shall be activated for the configured duration period.

children.heading: Supplemental Non-Communications Requirements
children.text: Supplemental requirements for ESS follow. These requirements do not directly involve communications between the management station and the ESS, but, if the supplemental requirement is selected in the PRL, the ESS shall fulfill the stated requirement to claim conformance to this document.

children.heading: Required Number of Atmospheric Pressure Sensors
children.text: The ESS shall support the number of atmospheric pressure sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of atmospheric pressure sensors, the number of atmospheric pressure sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default =1) atmospheric pressure sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Wind Sensors
children.text: The ESS shall support the number of wind sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of wind sensors, the number of wind sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default=1) wind sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Temperature Sensors
children.text: The ESS shall support the number of temperature sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of temperature sensors, the number of temperature sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default=1) temperature sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Humidity Sensors
children.text: The ESS shall support the number of humidity sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of humidity sensors, the number of humidity sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default=1) humidity sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Precipitation Sensors
children.text: The ESS shall support the number of precipitation sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of precipitation sensors, the number of precipitation sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default=1) precipitation sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Solar Radiation Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single set of values for the solar radiation; however, these values may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of solar radiation sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of solar radiation sensors, the number of solar radiation sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default=1) solar radiation sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Visibility Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single value for the visibility; however, this value may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of visibility sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of visibility sensors, the number of visibility sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default=1) visibility sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Pavement Sensors
children.text: The ESS shall support the number of pavement sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of pavement sensors, the number of pavement sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default=1) pavement sensors.

children.heading: Active Pavement Treatment Sensors
children.text: The ESS shall determine the predicted freeze-point of the pavement by actively freezing a portion of the mixture on the roadway surface.

children.heading: Passive Pavement Treatment Sensors
children.text: The ESS shall determine the freeze point of the pavement through an algorithm that does not require the freezing of the chemical mixture on the roadway surface.

Note: Different makes and models of equipment may use different algorithms for a variety of reasons. To overcome problems that may result from this variation, this document links each pavement sensor with a row of the module table so that a system can identify the make and model of the specific pavement sensor.

children.heading: Required Number of Subsurface Sensors
children.text: The ESS shall support the number of subsurface sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of subsurface sensors, the number of subsurface sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default=1) subsurface sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Pavement Treatment Products
children.text: The ESS shall support the number of pavement treatment products as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of pavement treatment products, the number of pavement treatment products supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ pavement treatment products (1..255).

children.heading: Required Number of Carbon Monoxide Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single value for carbon monoxide; however, this value may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of carbon monoxide sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of carbon monoxide sensors, the number of carbon monoxide sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (Default=1) carbon monoxide sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Carbon Dioxide Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single value for carbon dioxide; however, this value may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of carbon dioxide sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of carbon dioxide sensors, the number of carbon dioxide sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (Default=1) carbon dioxide sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Nitric Oxide Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single value for nitric oxide; however, this value may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of nitric oxide sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of nitric oxide sensors, the number of nitric oxide sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (Default=1) nitric oxide sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Nitrogen Dioxide Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single value for nitrogen dioxide; however, this value may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of nitrogen dioxide sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of nitrogen dioxide sensors, the number of nitrogen dioxide sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (Default=1) nitrogen dioxide sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Sulfur Dioxide Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single value for sulfur dioxide; however, this value may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of sulfur dioxide sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of sulfur dioxide sensors, the number of sulfur dioxide sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (Default=1) sulfur dioxide sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Ozone Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single value for ozone; however, this value may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of ozone sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of ozone sensors, the number of ozone sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (Default=1) ozone sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Small (10) Particulate Matter Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single value for small particulate matter; however, this value may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of small particulate matter sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of small particulate matter sensors, the number of small particulate matter sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (Default=1) small particulate matter sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Small (2.5) Particulate Matter Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single value for small particulate matter 2.5 microns or less in diameter; however, this value may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of small particulate matter ( 2.5 microns diameter) sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of small particulate matter ( 2.5 microns diameter) sensors, the number of small particulate matter (2.5) sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (Default=1) particulate matter (2.5) sensors.

children.heading: Required Number of Small (1.0) Particulate Matter Sensors
children.text: The communications interface only allows the ESS to return a single value for small particulate matter 1.0 microns or less in diameter; however, this value may be derived from multiple sensors. The ESS shall support the number of small particulate matter ( 1.0 microns diameter) sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of small particulate matter ( 1.0 microns diameter) sensors, the number of small particulate matter (1.0) sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).

children.heading: Required Number of Snapshot Cameras
children.text: The ESS shall support the number of snapshot cameras as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of snapshot cameras, the number of snapshot cameras supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default=1) snapshot cameras.

children.heading: Required Number of Water Level Sensors
children.text: The ESS shall support the number of water level sensors as defined by the agency specification. If the agency specification does not define the number of water level sensors, the number of water level sensors supported by the ESS is one (1).
children.additional: The ESS shall support at least ____ (1..255:Default=1) water level sensors.

children.heading: Support Camera Number in Filename
children.text: The ESS shall support the ability to specify a field in the filename parameter that is replaced by the camera number when a snapshot is saved. This is the '<camera>' field as defined in Section 5.16.3.9.

attributesChanged.text: The ESS shall support the ability to specify a field in the filename parameter that is replaced by the camera number when a snapshot is saved. This is the '<camera>' field as defined in Section Error! Reference source not found..

children.heading: Support Sequence Number in Filename
children.text: The ESS shall support the ability to specify a field in the filename parameter that is replaced by the current sequence number when a snapshot is saved. This is the '<sequence>' field as defined in Section 5.16.3.9.

attributesChanged.text: The ESS shall support the ability to specify a field in the filename parameter that is replaced by the current sequence number when a snapshot is saved. This is the '<sequence>' field as defined in Section Error! Reference source not found..

children.heading: Support Date in Filename
children.text: The ESS shall support the ability to specify a field in the filename parameter that is replaced by the current UTC date when a snapshot is saved. This is the '<date>' field as defined in Section 5.16.3.9.

attributesChanged.text: The ESS shall support the ability to specify a field in the filename parameter that is replaced by the current UTC date when a snapshot is saved. This is the '<date>' field as defined in Section Error! Reference source not found..

children.heading: Support Time in Filename
children.text: The ESS shall support the ability to specify a field in the filename parameter that is replaced by the current UTC time when a snapshot is saved. This is the '<time>' field as defined in Section 5.16.3.9.

attributesChanged.text: The ESS shall support the ability to specify a field in the filename parameter that is replaced by the current UTC time when a snapshot is saved. This is the '<time>' field as defined in Section Error! Reference source not found..

children.heading: Support Long Filenames
children.text: The ESS shall support the ability to specify filenames up to 255 characters in length, including any extension.

children.heading: Maximum Transmission Start Time
children.text: Upon satisfying a condition that triggers a transmission (exception-based reporting), the device shall begin transmission of the response message for that specified condition to the management station within the defined Maximum Transmission Start Time in units of milliseconds. Unless the agency specification indicates otherwise, the Maximum Transmission Start Time shall be 100 milliseconds. The Maximum Transmission Start Time is measured as the time between the exception based monitoring is first detected and the transmission of the first byte of the report.

discussion.comment: Comment submitted to ISO 26048-1 to include

children.heading: Conformant Security
children.text: To claim "conformance" with this document, a DMS shall only support protocols providing equivalent security to SNMPv3 per the rules of NTCIP 2301 v03. Implementations should support the communications stack defined in NTCIP 2301 v03 for the exchanged of data defined by this document.
NOTEThis excludes support for less secure protocols, such as SNMP versions prior to SNMP3. In other words, conformant devices do not have the installed code to activate prior versions of SNMP.

children.heading: Consistent Security
children.text:
To claim "consistency" with this document, a DMS shall:

  1. Support protocols providing equivalent security to SNMPv3 per the rules of NTCIP 2301 v03,
  2. Support less secure protocols (e.g., prior versions of SNMP), and
  3. Allow users to disable all protocols that are less secure than SNMPv3 according to NTCIP 2301 v03.
Implementations should support the communications stack defined in NTCIP 2301 v03 for the exchanged of data defined by this document.
NOTEConsistent devices are defined to allow agencies to start procuring and deploying SNMPv3-ready devices immediately, before their management station has been updated to support SNMPv3.

attributesChanged.text: The Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM) in zzzzz) identifies the standardized dialog that can be used to achieve each of the data exchange requirements defined in Section 0. Simple data exchange requirements reference one of the generic SNMP dialogs along with a list of data elements. These equate to a single message being sent (e.g., a GET request) containing the referenced data elements followed by the appropriate response per the generic dialog specification.

discussion.comment: Annex H states that this is part of the configuration but NTCIP 8004 states that all read-only objects are status objects. Do we need to allow for exceptions for read-only objects? In other words, is the assertion that some configuration objects can only be changed through non-SNMP methods? If so, do we need to create a third type of parameter? Or perhaps this is a special case of inter-related configuration object?

children.heading: Type of Station
children.text: Integer value that indicates the type of station. If the station is a hybrid station, it should be represented with two SNMP contexts, one would report automatic and report all automatic readings while the other would report staffed and provide only the human readings.
children.format:
value               description 
0 - automatic      the data is collected electronically/mechanically 
1 - staffed        the data is collected by humans 
2 - reserved
3 - missingValue   the type of station is unknown.
children.info:
The value of 2 has been explicitly defined as being reserved. To be defined as two stations (e.g., for a hybrid), a station needs to have two addresses and two instances of this MIB.

The syntax was changed from INTEGER (0..3) to an enumeration in version 05.
children.name: essTypeofStation
children.reference: WMO Binary Code Form FM 94 BUFR Table B item 0 02 001

children.heading: Door Status
children.text: Indicates whether any of the doors attached to the station are open. If the value is one (1), at least one door is open; if the value is zero (0), all doors associated with the ESS are closed.
children.info: This object was deprecated in v05 to migrate to a more generic SRSA design that allow reporting the status of each door associated with the ESS.
children.name: essDoorStatus

children.heading: Battery Status
children.text: Indicates the current charge stored in the battery.
children.format: Values 0 to 100 indicate percent of full charge. The value 101 indicates an error in determining the percent of charge.
children.info: This object was deprecated in v05 to migrate to a more generic SRSA design.
children.name: essBatteryStatus

attributesChanged.format: Values 0 to 100 indicate percent of full charge. The value 101 indicates an error in determining the percent of charge.

children.heading: Line Volts
children.text: Indicates the voltage measured on the incoming power line for the controller. The value reported indicates one-half of the actual voltage; thus, this object indicates a value of 55 when the voltage is 110 Vrms. This object shall only be used to indicate A/C power conditions. If the line power is DC, this object shall not apply (i.e., either is not supported or has a value of 255) and the essBatteryStatus object shall indicate the status of the batteries.
children.format: Values 0 through 254 shall indicate valid values. The value 254 shall mean a voltage of 508 Vrms or greater. The value of 255 shall indicate an error condition or missing value.
children.info: This object was deprecated in v05 to migrate to a more generic SRSA design.

children.heading: Station Meta Data Block
children.text:
An OER encoded string of the EssStationMetaData structure as defined below. 
This object is used for uploading configuration data from the ESS in a 
bandwidth efficient manner.

The OPTIONAL fields shall be present if the data is supported by the 
implementation and is valid. The OPTIONAL fields shall be omitted for any 
data that is invalid or not supported by the implementation.

EssStationMetaData ::= SEQUENCE {  
essNtcipCategory.0       OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essTypeOfStation.0       OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essLatitude.0         OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essLongitude.0         OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essReferenceHeight.0       OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essPressureHeight.0       OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essWindSensorHeight.0       OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
temperatureMetaData  SEQUENCE OF TemperatureMetaData  OPTIONAL,
pavementMetaData    SEQUENCE OF PavementMetaData    OPTIONAL,
subSurfaceMetaData  SEQUENCE OF SubSurfaceMetaData  OPTIONAL,
treatmentMetaData    SEQUENCE OF TreatmentMetaData    OPTIONAL
}

TemperatureMetaData ::= SEQUENCE {
essTemperatureSensorIndex.x    OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essTemperatureSensorHeight.x    OPTIONAL  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
}

PavementMetaData ::= SEQUENCE {
essPavementSensorIndex.x    OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essPavementType.x        OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essPavementElevation.x      OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essPavementExposure.x      OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essPavementSensorType.x      OPTIONAL  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
}

SubSurfaceMetaData ::= SEQUENCE {
essSubSurfaceSensorIndex.x    OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essSubSurfaceType.x      OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essSubSurfaceSensorDepth.x    OPTIONAL  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
}

TreatmentMetaData ::= SEQUENCE {
essPavementTreatmentIndex.x    OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essPaveTreatProductType.x    OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essPaveTreatProductForm.x    OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essPercentProductMix.x      OPTIONAL  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess 
}

children.heading: Weather Block
children.text:
An OER encoded string of the EssWeatherData structure as defined in Section 4.
This object is used for uploading current weather data from the ESS in a 
bandwidth efficient manner.

The OPTIONAL fields shall be present if the data is supported by the 
implementation and is valid. The OPTIONAL fields shall be omitted for any 
data that is invalid or not supported by the implementation.

EssWeatherData ::= SEQUENCE {
essAtmosphericPressure.0    OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essWindData          EssWindData      OPTIONAL,
essTemperatureData      EssTemperatureData  OPTIONAL,
essPrecipData        EssPrecipData    OPTIONAL,
essVisibilityData         EssVisibilityData    OPTIONAL
}

EssWindData ::= SEQUENCE {
essAvgWindDirection.0      OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essAvgWindSpeed.0        OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essWindSituation.0      OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essMaxWindGustSpeed.0      OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essMaxWindGustDir.0      OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essSpotWindDirection.0      OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essSpotWindSpeed.0      OPTIONAL  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
}

EssTemperatureData ::= SEQUENCE {
essWetBulbTemp.0        OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essDewpointTemp.0        OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essMaxTemp.0        OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essMinTemp.0        OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essRelativeHumidity.0      OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
  -- for (
--   x = 1; 
--   x < essNumTemperatureSensors.0; 
--   x++)
temperatureTable      SEQUENCE OF Temperature  OPTIONAL
}


Temperature ::= SEQUENCE {
essTemperatureSensorIndex.x    OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essAirTemperature.x      OPTIONAL  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
}


EssPrecipData ::= SEQUENCE { 
essWaterDepth.0        OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess
essAdjacentSnowDepth.0      OPTIONAL,  -- @NTCIP1204-Ess

}
